description: Number of red-black rooted trees with n-1 internal nodes.
comments: Are a(2) = a(3) = 2 and a(4) = 3 the only primes in this sequence? - _Jonathan Vos Post_, Jun 17 2005
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Red-Black Tree.
Index entries for sequences related to rooted trees
formula: a(1) = 1, a(2) = 2 and for n>2: a(n) = Sum_[n/4 <= m <= n/2] binomial(2m,n-2m)*a(m), John Moon, as quoted in Ruskey. - _Jonathan Vos Post_, Jun 17 2005.G.f. satisfies: A(x) = x+x^2 + A((x+x^2)^2). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Jun 14 2012
maple: spec := [B, {B=Union(Z, Subst(M, B)), M=Union(Prod(Z,Z),Prod(Z,Z,Z,Z))} ]; [seq(combstruct[count](spec, size=2*n), n=0..40)]; # from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 21 2000. Compare A014535, A037026.
prog: (PARI) {a(n)=local(A=x+x^2+x*O(x^n)); for(i=1, n, A=x+x^2+subst(A,x,(x+x^2)^2+x*O(x^n))); polcoeff(A, n)} \\ _Paul D. Hanna_, Jun 14 2012
author: _Frank Ruskey_
